name: Cambridge Spark
description: Cambridge Spark’s mission is to transform tech education for professionals with an intelligent tutoring system. Our proprietary system brings together research in software engineering, source code analysis, education pedagogy and machine learning. Cambridge Spark has recently won a government innovation grant to collaborate with Oxford University on recommender systems research applied for education.

team.name: Raoul-Gabriel Urma
team.bioHtml: CEO Cambridge Spark, Chairman Cambridge Coding Academy, PhD Computer Science, Java Champion, Best-selling Book Author, Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts, Geek

jobs.title: Full Stack Python Web Developer
jobs.description: This is an exciting role as we are a small fast-paced team. You’ll have  a variety of engineering challenges, from building serverless APIs to developing our main web app used by our students to access personalised feedback and recommendations from our algorithms. Our engineers contribute to many aspects of our product on a regular basis, providing you with a diverse range of projects to work on and learn new skills. You will also have the opportunity to deliver training courses.
jobs.descriptionHtml: This is an exciting role as we are a small fast-paced team. You’ll have a variety of engineering challenges, from building serverless APIs to developing our main web app used by our students to access personalised feedback and recommendations from our algorithms. Our engineers contribute to many aspects of our product on a regular basis, providing you with a diverse range of projects to work on and learn new skills. You will also have the opportunity to deliver training courses.

jobs.title: Tech Education Sales Representative
jobs.description:
We are looking for a driven sales professional to join our founding team. You will be part of our mission of helping professionals become more relevant in the technology industry with our Data Science and Python programming bootcamps and training courses.

The bootcamps and training courses sales team is responsible for ensuring each potential student understands what it takes to be successful in a Cambridge Spark course. In this role you are responsible for driving revenue that allows Cambridge Spark to continue to grow, scale, and make a difference to the life of professionals in the tech industry.

About us 

Cambridge Spark is a edtech spin-out from the Cambridge Computer Laboratory with a focus on personalised education in the fields of Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security. 

You’ll join a team of Computer Science and Data Science researchers, Big Data Engineers and PhDs from the University of Cambridge, the University of Oxford, Imperial College London and UCL who have experience working at some of the world’s most well known tech companies including Google, Oracle, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft and Qualcomm.

Cambridge Spark’s mission is to transform tech education for professionals with an intelligent AI-powered talent development platform. Our proprietary system brings together research in software engineering, source code analysis, education pedagogy and machine learning. Cambridge Spark has recently won a government innovation grant to collaborate with Oxford University on recommender systems research applied to education. 

We’ve trained thousands of students and current customers include professionals from JPMorgan, Morgan Stanley, Total and HSBC.

Responsibilities:

Grow sales by helping to achieve a five-fold increase in revenue in 2019
Achieve personal targets and manage a robust pipeline of prospective students; build and cultivate relationships on an ongoing basis to drive results
Interview prospective students to ensure that their qualifications and interests are a match for our programs
Proactively manage and respond to a high volume of prospective students and businesses efficiently
Host and lead in-person information sessions


Competencies and requirements:

2+ years experience in consultative sales, consumer sales, enterprise sales, admissions or recruiting
Driven by meeting numbers and experience exceeding quotas, achieving results in a target-driven environment; competitive personality
Outstanding communication skills on the phone and ability to influence others internally and externally
Exceptional closing skills while still remaining welcoming, understanding, and empathetic
Ability to think on your feet, try new approaches and bounce back when things don’t go your way
Ability to tie an individual’s wants and needs into a logical solution
Confidence pitching to both individuals and groups
You have an entrepreneurial instinct: you are willing to do more than just sell. You will help with marketing, product, and training to help the company succeed 
Hunter mindset: You are coachable, competitive, and efficient
Undergraduate degree
Experience using Hubspot is a plus
Background and previous experience in the education and tech industry is a plus  

At Cambridge Spark, your benefits will include:

- Opportunities to grow within the company and rapidly acquire more responsibilities based on performance and interests
- Monthly company socials and Cambridge College formals.
- Access to our Data Science and Machine Learning Summits in Cambridge, London and Manchester and opportunity to attend other conferences and training
- Competitive pay
- Accelerated uncapped compensation plan

We are looking for a driven sales professional to join our founding team. You will be part of our mission of helping professionals become more relevant in the technology industry with our Data Science and Python programming bootcamps and training courses.

The bootcamps and training courses sales team is responsible for ensuring each potential student understands what it takes to be successful in a Cambridge Spark course. In this role you are responsible for driving revenue that allows Cambridge Spark to continue to grow, scale, and make a difference to the life of professionals in the tech industry.

Cambridge Spark is a edtech spin-out from the Cambridge Computer Laboratory with a focus on personalised education in the fields of Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security.

You’ll join a team of Computer Science and Data Science researchers, Big Data Engineers and PhDs from the University of Cambridge, the University of Oxford, Imperial College London and UCL who have experience working at some of the world’s most well known tech companies including Google, Oracle, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft and Qualcomm.

Our proprietary system brings together research in software engineering, source code analysis, education pedagogy and machine learning. Cambridge Spark has recently won a government innovation grant to collaborate with Oxford University on recommender systems research applied to education.

We’ve trained thousands of students and current customers include professionals from JPMorgan, Morgan Stanley, Total and HSBC.

Ability to think on your feet, try new approaches and bounce back when things don’t go your way

You have an entrepreneurial instinct: you are willing to do more than just sell. You will help with marketing, product, and training to help the company succeed

Undergraduate degree

  • Access to our Data Science and Machine Learning Summits in Cambridge, London and Manchester and opportunity to attend other conferences and training
  • Competitive pay
  • Accelerated uncapped compensation plan
